page.title: 17Gipsies in Ash.
page.content: The gipsies or 'Travellers' as they prefer to be called have been a part of the scene in Ash since the begining of the century. The original families bought plots of land in the area known as The Quadrant between the two railway lines. They lived in 'benders' which are tents made out of tarpaulins streched over ash poles. The families spent the summer doing farm work in the area and travelling on waggons drawn by a horse with a second horse to help on the hills. They helped with fruit picking, hay-making ,harvest and hop picking and other seasonal jobs. Many of the original families are still in the village and live in the council houses that have replaced the benders ,trailers and pre-fabs that have occupied the Quadrant.
